net.xeoh.plugins.base.options.getplugin

Class OptionPluginSelector<P extends Plugin>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.xeoh.plugins.base.options.getplugin.OptionPluginSelector<P>
  • Type Parameters:
    P - Type of the plugin.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Option, GetPluginOption

    public final class OptionPluginSelector<P extends Plugin>
extends java.lang.Object
implements GetPluginOption
    Passes a plugin selector as an option. The selector will be called for each considered plugin. The first plugin on which the collector returns true will be returned. For example, to select a remote service based on its protocol, write:

    getPlugin(RemoteAPI.class, new OptionPluginSelector (new PluginSelector () {
        public boolean selectPlugin(final RemoteAPI p) {
            if (p.getPublishMethod() == PublishMethod.JSON) return true;
                return false;
    }
    }));


    The plugin selector is especially useful to iterate over all plugins, PluginManagerUtil already does that for you.
    Author:
    Ralf Biedert
    See Also:
    PluginManager, Serialized Form
